bug.short_desc: virt-install --connect lxc:// fails with selinux AVC, causes dbus timeout
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
I can reproduce. When I do 'setenforce 0' the messages I see from sealert are:
type=AVC msg=audit(1469569263.56:715): avc: denied { read } for pid=11200 comm="systemd-machine" name="cgroup" dev="proc" ino=416585 scontext=system_u:system_r:systemd_machined_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:virtd_lxc_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=file permissive=1
type=AVC msg=audit(1469569263.56:714): avc: denied { search } for pid=11200 comm="systemd-machine" name="11727" dev="proc" ino=450600 scontext=system_u:system_r:systemd_machined_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:virtd_lxc_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=dir permissive=1
type=AVC msg=audit(1469569263.56:716): avc: denied { open } for pid=11200 comm="systemd-machine" path="/proc/11727/cgroup" dev="proc" ino=416585 scontext=system_u:system_r:systemd_machined_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:virtd_lxc_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=file permissive=1
type=AVC msg=audit(1469569263.56:717): avc: denied { getattr } for pid=11200 comm="systemd-machine" path="/proc/11727/cgroup" dev="proc" ino=416585 scontext=system_u:system_r:systemd_machined_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:virtd_lxc_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=file permissive=1
So nothing about dbus send_msg, however the error returned from libvirt certainly points to dbus like you suggest.
ERROR internal error: guest failed to start: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.

The message i see is this one:
USER_AVC pid=2020 uid=81 auid=4294967295 ses=4294967295 subj=system_u:system_r:system_dbusd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 msg='avc: denied { send_msg } for msgtype=method_return dest=:1.202 spid=5412 tpid=10693 scontext=system_u:system_r:systemd_machined_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:virtd_lxc_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=dbus exe="/usr/bin/dbus-daemon" sauid=81 hostname=? addr=? terminal=?'

I confirm the issue and the solution. It also happens when the LXC virtual machine was created with a previous version of Fedora, and the distribution was system-upgraded to F24. (I upgraded my server and the virtual machine refused to start).
I'm pretty sure this was fixed with an selinux policy update, but if anyone can still reproduce, please reopen
